p: Macroalgae (or seaweeds) contain high amounts of carbohydrates (up to 60%), medium/high amounts of proteins (10–47%) and low amounts of lipids (1–3%) with a variable content of mineral ash (7–38%) [ 5]. With decreasing available land and fresh-water resources, the oceans have become attractive alternatives for the production of valuable biomass, comparable to terrestrial crops. Macroalgae cultivated under controlled and sustainable cultivation systems are probably the future method for supplying biomass to meet market development needs [ 6].
